snippet: Two new books, Paul Krugman’s “End This Depression Now!” and Timothy Noah’s “Great Divergence,” are an attempt to disabuse the rich of the idea that we’re in a sustainable recovery.
abstract: Felix Salmon reviews books End This Depression Now! by Paul Krugman and The Great Divergence: America's Growing Inequality Crisis and What We Can Do About It by Timothy Noah.
lead_paragraph: Two new books, Paul Krugman’s “End This Depression Now!” and Timothy Noah’s “Great Divergence,” are an attempt to disabuse the rich of the idea that we’re in a sustainable recovery.

headline.seo: Paul Krugman and Timothy Noah on the Economy
headline.main: Speaking to the Haves, in a Plea to Consider All the Have-Nots
headline.print_headline: Speaking to the Haves, In a Plea to Consider All The Have-Nots

keywords.value: The Great Divergence: America's Growing Inequality Crisis and What We Can Do about It (Book)
